exam.title: Departamento de Idiomas. Escuela de Guerra | INGLÉS
exam.intro1: En las sucesivas presentaciones usted encontrará preguntas de tipo test relacionadas con la conversación que debe escuchar previamente en la parte izquierda de la misma.
exam.intro2: Después de escuchar la conversación en inglés deberá responder a una de las preguntas de la parte derecha.
exam.intro3: Gracias por su colaboración. A continuación podrá imprimir las respuestas que han sido seleccionadas, o bien imprimirlas en un archivo pdf para su entrega al profesor correspondiente.
exam.timeOver: Su tiempo ha terminado. Pulse finalizar e imprima sus respuestas

question.Question: 35. Photographing food Now, believe it or not, even Pentagon brownies can be made to look delicious for the cameras. That's what Delores Custer does for a living. She's a professional food stylist. And she's written a book about how it's done. It's called 'Food Styling.' And Delores Custer joins me from Portland. Welcome. Ms. DELORES CUSTER (Food Stylist; Author, 'Food Styling'): Thank you. RAZ: Now, we have all seen the perfect bowl of cereal, right? You know... Ms. CUSTER: Mm-hmm. dfdfdsf dsfgdsfdsfdsgvfdgvdfgvdf gfgvdfsgvfre gre g reg e get rg rt ret re tg re re tg re tgre g fe f rew rew tr f ew few r rew e fdgvfdgv df r q a a aasss dfd f trt eded e e ferg fre tr trh tr e frfre fdgvfd edf fre f ref retg re tg regt rg fr g r gtr e redf g gvfdgvdfgvdf gfgvdfsgvfre gre g reg e get rg rt ret re tg re re tg re tgre g fe f rew rew tr f ew few r rew e fdgvfdgv df r q a a aasss dfd f trt eded e e ferg fre tr trh tr e frfre fdgvfd edf fre f ref retg re tg regt rg fr g r gtr e redf g fdfdsgfsdgfds gvdsgfdsgfdsgdfsgdfsgvfds gvfdgvdfgvdf gfgvdfsgvfre gre g reg e get rg rt ret re tg re re tg re tgre g fe f rew rew tr f ew few r rew e fdgvfdgv df r q a a aasss dfd f trt eded e e ferg fre tr trh tr e frfre fdgvfd edf fre f ref retg re tg regt rg fr g r gtr e redf g gvfd gvfdgv fd RAZ: ...the perfect blueberry or the perfect strawberry just hitting the milk. Ms. CUSTER: Mm-hmm. RAZ: You've got that perfect splash and then these perfectly situated Corn Flakes and they each have a few perfect drops of milk on them. Ms. CUSTER: Mm-hmm. RAZ: Is that milk? Ms. CUSTER: Some of the times, it is. Most of the time, it's not. In the early days, that splash was acrylic. And we would have a model maker make the splash. Today, with digital, it can be a real splash or oftentimes it's illustrated... .. Now, if we're selling milk, we have to use milk. If we're selling the cereal, then we sort through and we find what I call flakes with character. ... And we arrange those in a bowl, and then we do use something other than milk if it's going to take the photographer a long time to shoot.

answers.answ1: A. To sell cereal the milk must be fresh
answers.answ2: B. If the ad is for cereal, the milk doesn't have to be real
answers.answ3: C. If the ad is for milk, the milk can be real or digital
answers.answ4: D. With the arrival of digital nothing in the photo is real

question.Question:
36. Sibling rivalry – gas pricing dispute The case involves the terms of a deal under which Reliance Industries was to supply Reliance Natural Resources, headed by Mukesh Ambani's brother Anil, with a pre-agreed amount of gas for 17 years at a rate 44% below the rate set by the government. But the court order stated that the government has a right to fix a price for the gas, and that two individuals cannot decide the price of a national asset. The court asked the two brothers to thrash out a fresh agreement within six weeks. The five-year battle between the billionaire brothers has dominated national news and the verdict in favour of the country's most valuable company is expected to influence trading in the stock markets. The case involves the terms of a deal under which Reliance Industries was to supply Reliance Natural Resources, headed by Mukesh Ambani's brother Anil, with a pre-agreed amount of gas for 17 years at a rate 44% below the rate set by the government. But the court order stated that the government has a right to fix a price for the gas, and that two individuals cannot decide the price of a national asset. The court asked the two brothers to thrash out a fresh agreement within six weeks. The five-year battle between the billionaire brothers has dominated national news and the verdict in favour of the country's most valuable company is expected to influence trading in the stock markets. The case involves the terms of a deal under which Reliance Industries was to supply Reliance Natural Resources, headed by Mukesh Ambani's brother Anil, with a pre-agreed amount of gas for 17 years at a rate 44% below the rate set by the government. But the court order stated that the government has a right to fix a price for the gas, and that two individuals cannot decide the price of a national asset. The court asked the two brothers to thrash out a fresh agreement within six weeks. But the court order stated that the government has a right to fix a price for the gas, and that two individuals cannot decide the price of a national asset. The court asked the two brothers to thrash out a fresh agreement within six weeks. The five-year battle between the billionaire brothers has dominated national news and the verdict in favour of the country's most valuable company is expected to influence trading in the stock markets. The case involves the terms of a deal under which Reliance Industries was to supply Reliance Natural Resources, headed by Mukesh Ambani's brother Anil, with a pre-agreed amount of gas for 17 years at a rate 44% below the rate set by the government. But the court order stated that the government has a right to fix a price for the gas, and that two individuals cannot decide the price of a national asset. The court asked the two brothers to thrash out a fresh agreement within six weeks. The five-year battle between the billionaire brothers has dominated national news and the verdict in favour of the country's most valuable company is expected to influence trading in the stock markets. The case involves the terms of a deal under which Reliance Industries was to supply Reliance Natural Resources, headed by Mukesh Ambani's brother Anil, with a pre-agreed amount of gas for 17 years at a rate 44% below the rate set by the government. But the court order stated that the government has a right to fix a price for the gas, and that two individuals cannot decide the price of a national asset. The court asked the two brothers to thrash out a fresh agreement within six weeks. The five-year battle between the billionaire brothers has dominated national news and the verdict in favour of the country's most valuable company is expected to influence trading in the stock markets.
Which statement is true according to what you have heard?

answers.answ1: A. The government cannot establish a price for the gas
answers.answ2: B. The dispute between the brothers has been going on for nine years
answers.answ3: C. Gas –pricing regulations in India do not affect the stock markets
answers.answ4: D. The brothers have been given a time limit to draw up a new agreement

question.Question: 37. The head of Caesar Augustus Presenter; I’m looking into the eyes of one of the most famous leaders in the History of the World - Caesar Augustus, the first Roman Emperor. We h What can be deduced from the extract?

answers.answ1: A. Caesar’s image was calculated to transmit specific qualities
answers.answ2: B. Caesar introduced football to ancient Rome
answers.answ3: C. The bronze head of Caesar is in a gallery in Rome
answers.answ4: D. The tousled hair makes Caesar look old

question.Question: 38. Pensioners’ revolt What can be deduced from the extract?

answers.answ1: A. Some clients tortured their financial advisor
answers.answ2: B. The financial advisor was on trial for the sub-prime melt-down
answers.answ3: C. The financial advisor was taken on a holiday for four days
answers.answ4: D. The pensioners had risked their money on real estate
